One of the better burgers I've had. Perfectly greasy, very tasty. The Cajun fries are excellent. Really solid beer selection. The environment is great. Really glad we made this part of our trip.

What a fun spot! It looks like a great place for a burger and a shake, but we stopped in for breakfast. Had a wonderful breakfast burrito (something we don't really have here in Texas, and the only improvement I would have made would be to add some hot peppers and cilantro). It was the "Machaca Burrito" ($4.95, grilled beef with onions, peppers and eggs in a flour tortilla). The salsa that came on the side wasn't much, but the burrito was great.  The prices here are great. I don't know when I'll be in Cave Creek again, but I'd love to come back.
If you want a big ol tastely cheesburger this is your place. Brings back memories from when I was a kid love this place for a meal cheat day for sure.

I come back to this place every single time I am in Phoenix to visit. We LOVE it. My boyfriend is vegetarian he LOVES the blackened veggie burger and I enjoy the blackened chicken sandwich! Omg! Everything from the environment to the food is amazing. Love that you have doggie water bowls too! Seriously. I am a server myself and from Colorado and would love to work here if I ever moved to Arizona! The staff is always cleaning something, friendly and the misters are genius! Live this place! You have a great establishment! 100%!
Kinda pricy, but the food is decent and the service great. If you haven't had one of their thick milkshakes or malts, you haven't lived.

OMG!!!!! I love Big Earl's so much. I just tried it for the 1st time and had a Cheddar cheese burger with green chile and it was amazing. I called 3 family members after to tell them and left messages on 2 of my friend's phones. I love spreading the word about amazing foods that needs to stick around :)

Oh biscuits and gravy, how I love thee.  After a night out line dancing, watching bullriding, and watching cowboys; we needed some hangover food.  This is was just the remedy.    A tiny little old timey diner, with vintage gas pumps outside it's adorable.  I'm confused by the two stripper poles though.  We were there in the morning, so I'm not sure what the heck those are used for. ;)  I ordered the Biscuits and Gravy and a side of bacon. The biscuits were light and the sausage gravy was delicious. Nice and peppery and thick. Yum. The bacon was extra crispy/near burnt per my request.  I *do* wish they served Coke rather than Pepsi products, however.  I was very jealous of another person's chicken fried steak and will be ordering that next time.  A friend of mine ordered pancakes and declared it the best one she'd ever had.    Service was fast and friendly.    They must be a night place as well being as how they served beer and wine as well.  Perhaps that's why there are stripper poles?
The burgers are great.  Just look for the old gas station with the red awning.  We enjoyed the music too.

I was doing errands, and decided to stop for breakfast. I asked the girl at the register what was good. She suggested the egg sandwich.  I had mine made with hash browns, bacon, and of course, eggs, on sour dough. I also had a cup of coffee, to wash it down.  The sandwich came to my table in a short time. The sour dough bread was perfectly toasted, with lots of butter. My first bite,  surprised me, how hot everything was. The hash browns were crispy, the bacon was also crispy. The eggs were cooked to perfection. Bottom line. It was killer!  The staff are very friendly, and up beat. The place is always clean, as are the restrooms.  Thanks again for another great meal.

I heard about this place from a friend. We went with another couple and sat on the patio after ordering. This place is fun because it's an old gas station, complete with gas pumps and memorabilia. The employees were very friendly and the food was really good! I ordered a chocolate shake with Kahlua in it, really good!  They have a full bar for being a small place. The burgers and fries were good.

Went here after a very long off-roading trip with some of my friends, and we all enjoyed our meals. I don't remember what kind of burger I got, but it was really good. They have this coffee milkshake/malt that is absolutely to die for! They even asked if we wanted some of the coffee grounds in there and it was so good! The people there were really happy and fun to talk to; it seemed like they really enjoyed working there. The ambiance was very nice and fun. Great place to stop if you're in Cave Creek!
First time back since new owner...she was super friendly and the kids loved their burgers.  Dad was happy with an IPA.
Always my first stop when I come into the Carefree/ Cave Creek area. Very cool little place!   Great food and friendly people.

We passed this place on the way to Carefree.  Looked fun so we turned around and when in for lunch.  GREAT MOVE.   The staff is upbeat and fun. We had burger and fries.  One of the best we have had.  Service was not only great but fast.  We will be going back.

Food is tasty and a good value. Don't let the name fool you, not everything on the menu is greasy. Wish they had a little more indoor seating so one could avoid the flies and the heat, but I guess that is part of the restaurant's character.

Very happy I chose this place today for lunch. Very very friendly staff and a pretty darn good Burger! The french fries are not that great but that's alright that's why they got four stars instead of five, but I will definitely return for another one of these delicious burgers and wonderful service. I like to set up and the atmosphere also. Great quick stop for Cave Creek. Will definitely recommend to friends.

OMG SO good!! The food is amazing. Breakfast burritos are killer! All different kinds of burgers which is the best part.. Never gets old!! Great beer selection. Owner works in the place which is hard to come by nowadays!! And she's hot!!

Yosemite Sam Look Alike, Big Earl,& his Greasy Eats weren't Greasy actually, But he kinda was.This place is a Hoot!!!A converted Old Gas Station, lots of Local Characters with Great Character. They even had a great Veggie Burger for me,as well as Great Angus Burgers,Fries,and the BEST Malts we have ever had- you could taste fresh Vanilla Bean.Maltamania these Malts are some kinda Nirvana Drug!!!Chat it up with the Local Color while you wait for your Custom Order to come up. You get the feel you are in the Best of the Ol' Wild West here, Dig On In, Like A Thirsty Tic on a Puppy, because it just doesn't get better than this TRUE GRUB.Mosey on Over & grab ya some, not so Greasy as advertised, Greasy Eaten Lippity Smackitty Do Da

I want to give 4 stars & I would have if there was just some needed upkeep and cleaning done to the place.  I really liked the set-up & I understand it's old and outside, which makes it tough to keep clean, but a little extra effort would go a long way.  That being said, burger was great, service was great...will definitely be back.

As this was the only place that was open til 12:00 and we were starving, they told us they were close and it was 11:30. Pretty lame since we had to drive to Phoenix (about an hour away) to get to the nearest 24 hour food restaurant. Thanks guys smh
Delivers on it's promises. Great food with good size portions when you want some greasy eats. The place has LOTS of character!

First time trying Big Earl's and was pleasantly surprised.  Don't come here for fancy ambiance because you will be disappointed.  Come here if you want to try good food in a VERY basic surroundings.  No frills and kept the garage theme inside. Minimal seating inside (4 tables) and plenty of outside seating available. Great customer service and attention to quality of food. We had breakfast The American and everything was cooked to order and was good flavor.  Coffee is also up to par with other restaurants.  Come on a sunshiny day and enjoy your experience.

Nice setting with converted gas station, friendly personnel and clientele, which  contributes to a nice atmosphere. Kids (we have 6) can be picky about food, but all of them liked their burgers, fries and shakes. So did we. Definitely coming back.
You know I love this place. Who wouldn't love a place that has a white trash party. The Halloween party is off the charts too.

Loved it. Great fun vibe. Yummy burgers.  Good sweet potato fries and my friend had a peanut butter chocolate shake that was the best I've ever tasted.  Wish I didn't live so far from this place but will take my son.  Kids will love it.
This place looks divey but the food is surprisingly good! Both their breakfast and lunch are great. A must when in the cave creek area

I have lived in Carefree for 7 years and always pass BE's, but I never stopped in. Since relatives are coming for a visit in September, I was seeking out a place for breakfast (too few around this area) so last Friday I dropped in after 7 AM and ordered pancakes and a small espresso shake. Holy Flapjacks, Batman! For $4.95 I got three humongous pancakes, fluffy and delish, and I almost died in pleasure with the shake. I couldn't even finish the pancakes (which were provided with real butter and maple syrup). I went back the next day to check out the hamburgers. I got the mushroom and Swiss (no mayo), fries, and a LARGE espresso shake. The fries rival McD's, and the burger was very good. Both times the service was wonderful, and I always give a 20% tip. I ate on the patio both times. Much hotter during lunch (obviously), but nice ambience except for the LOUD noise of passing traffic. All in all, A place I would definitely take my family to experience something unusual and cool as opposed to restaurants and chains.

I've been here at least a dozen times in the past two years. I have yet to notice a single problem in terms of their food. The complaint about the meat being frozen and overcooked, I don't know who was cooking when you went there. The patties are always thick & juicy and way more fresh than you would find at any burger chain.  They have great variety with the burgers or chicken sandwiches. Big Kahuna burger, Bleu Buffalo chicken sandwich, and Mushroom Swiss burger are my top three picks. They have a corn dog special that is priced great and tastes even better. Salads, hot dogs, burritos you name it.  Breakfast items are out of this world good. French toast and biscuits & gravy A+  I suggest trying Earls special sauce, it's a black pepper type mayo that is divine. Also their salsa verde is equally delicious.  For the price, it's more than your dollar menu obviously, but you pay for the quality and in my opinion it could be even more expensive. They don't have a huge seating area, I usually order take out and bring the food home. I've eaten dinner inside one weeknight and it seems to only get busy on weekends. Breakfast is a different story, sitting out outside several times in the a.m. was very peaceful.  The time it takes to get your meal is average, there is one cook most of the time so I don't expect fast food assembly line service.
What a delicious burger! The new owner has really done a great job improving the food at Big Earls. It was one of the best burgers I have ever had. The fries were great too!
Way over rated.  Burger tasted like it was cooked on a grill that hadn't been cleaned since the gas station closed.  Fries were worst example of cheapest they could buy from a Wholesaler.

If you have never been to downtown Cave Creek it's time to do.  I was doing some shopping and Big Earls was a nice stop for lunch. It's a converted gas station and local hangout for a greasy burger and fries.  My burger was excellent.  The onion rings were okay when compared to Pinks in Hollywood being the best.   Still a solid lunch with 50's music and great service.  I'll be back!!!

Been going here for years! Love it! Cool that an old gas station was converted to a restaurant. Sand volleyball in the back and nice patio. Cheeseburgers, Cajun fries and milkshakes rock! Kiddo does love chicken here as well. A destination if you are in Cave Creek!

I have not tried their food, but in the middle of stuffy Cave Creek with the well-to-do (possibley the owner of this fine establishment belongs to this social demographic?) I was presented with the STRONGEST and most delicious quad-shot, 32 Oz espresso drink I've ever had.  So totally did not expect to find that here.  The staff was nice and friendly, but with a "don't fuck with me or I will hand you your ass" edge...  Very awesome.  The restaurant is fucking killer , I love the design and feel of it.  Going inside is like walking inside your dad's garagewhile he's working on his hot rod,  and sharing a sandwich with him.  My kid loved it too, probably cause the lady behind the counter slid her a mammoth sized chocolate milk topped with whipped cream.

OK but generally disappointment.  Cold winter day.  Not much seating inside but luckily we got some.  Not much variety in menu.  We would have walked out but were hungry so instead we split a patty melt and fries since we knew we going to get something that tasted better later.  Just didn't do it for us.

My husband asked me to write this review. He always orders the Kobe burger whenever it's available, so that's what he ordered here. Said it was the worst Kobe burger he's ever had. Edible, but didn't even taste like Kobe meat. He said it seemed more like one of those frozen shaped patties. Perhaps other food is good here, so this review is strictly for their Kobe burger. I hate leaving bad reviews for my local places, so perhaps we will come back and try something different, and I'll update my review accordingly.
Decent food and the prices are pretty good. We went a few times but it's really not worth the drive without a groupon.  Too many restaurants in town that make a better burger.

For a place that puts greasy in its name we thought the hamburgers lacked the required amount of grease.  I had a Big Earl with green chile and onion rings and hubby had one with bacon, egg and sweet potato fries.  The burgers and fries were ok.  The star of the meal was the onion rings - if I was reviewing them for these alone it would 5 star.  I would come back if I was in Carefree looking for a hamburger, but I wouldn't go out of my way to get here.  I was so hoping for a great greasy burger.  I did love the gas station converted to hamburger stand look though!

I have wanted to eat here since my wife and I moved to Cave Creek, and we finally made it in. The burgers were great, the staff was incredibly friendly and the atmosphere was fantastic. Overall we had an amazing time, and we will definitely be back.  The only reason I didnt give 5 stars is because our fries were soggy, but hey, they were still fries, and thats not why we went there. Great experience, and I would recommend this place to all.  We will be back!

The worst place to eat in Cave Creek The staff are a bunch of checked out, rude and entitled young people. The food is horribly inconsistent. .. You are often given overcooked burned burgers or worse undercooked raw chicken.... If you complain and ask them to correct the food they argue with you and are extremely rude! They have zero interest in customer satisfaction ....

We have been coming here since they have opened and have never had a bad meal. Whether it's a burger, grilled cheese or a salad, they always hit a 'home run.'  If you want white table cloths, and need a constantly filled water glass you can stay away. However, if you want a good burger, fresh French fries, and a fantastic shake, head to Big Earl's.
Weird restaurant with flavorless food. Serving $5 burgers/sandwiches for $9. Good came out cold and we were the only table. Wasted $44 on 3 adult sandwiches and 2 kids meals with one fries.
The people are nice the food is great my favorite is the grilled cheese and fries  They Also allow Dogs on their back patio not sure if anyone knows that because I never see any there
Great comfort food in a fun environment! The line can get a little long, but if you know that going in, it isn't horrible.  We love Big Earl's!

Our boy is on fall break , so why not a small roadie to beautiful Cave Creek !  Earls came highly recommended by locals and friends . I had the Black and Bleu , and boy was that a tasty burger ! The Harris Ranch beef was incredible . Just enough fat to give right flavor and was seasoned perfectly . One of the best burgers I've ever had !  The boy had a Big Earl cheddar KPMustard , and he gobbled it down and was happy . Would definitely show my face in that restaurant again and again . Old gas station vibe decor was really cool , some time was put into the presentation of the property . The food speaks for it self in Aces

I've only been here for breakfast so this review is based on that.  Also I've only tried two things on their menu at breakfast.  Chicken fried steak and the breakfast burrito.  I would recommend both and would say try the burrito on your first visit.  I like bacon eggs and cheese.  Best part is their salsa they give with it sooo good.  Besides that big earls has the type of home town feel you want when you walk into a breakfast place solo.  A smile and a friendly what can I get you.  The chef there is super friendly often times brings my food out to me directly.  He also told me about the Indian fry bread place down the street and their spinach enchiladas which are so good as well.  Bottom line big earls is hometown, down to earth and exactly what you would expect to get when you walk in and I love it.  Cheers guys!

Our favorite place in Cave Creek! We love the BBQ burger and Big kahuna chicken sandwich. You can't beat the unique atmosphere and friendly staff. Highly recommend Big Earls !!   The chicken fried steak for breakfast is a must. Pictured below.

Took a group of about 15 here on our way back into Phoenix from Seven Springs and had a great time.  The burgers are phenomenal.  The fries and shake I got are on par, but the burgers really are fantastic.    The venue is very inviting and open, with a really fun sand volleyball court in the back that we took full advantage of.  It did help that it was also about 75 degrees with a slight breeze.  Just a perfect day, and a great little joint to grab a burger done the right way.  I would recommend this place to anyone rolling through Cave Creek.
Great area...Great food...Great staff. Stop by and support Cave Creek and the Southwest. We need this community now more than ever.

This is a great spot for lunch in Cave Creek. We came up on Sunday to explore the general area (which is a blast on the weekends if you haven't tried it yet - lots of bikers and bars). The line was out the door, but the old fashioned style burgers and chocolate malt were well worth the wait. They also have free wifi...
Loved this place with lots of local color, great eats, superb service from Brooke and the rest of the staff......AND.....spotless bathrooms.
Excellent food! Great atmosphere! Professional service!! One of my favorite places in Cave Creek.

I had breakfast here with my brothers and we had a good time.  Food was good and it was fun sitting outside.  Tables by the street, and Cave Creek Road is at a crawl through there so it isn't stressful having cars whiz by. The decor is entertaining, and we enjoyed the photo prop they had there you can stick your head through.  Had a decent cup of java and a breakfast burrito.  Sign out front is very interesting retro look, and the whole place is  fifties cool as befits the ex-gas station theme.  Lot's of interesting stuff on the walls inside while you stand around placing your order.

The best part of Big Earl's is the atmosphere. The place has a ton of personality.  The burgers are solid - we had the Big Earl, the Kobe and the spicy Blue. Long with fries, tater toros and fried Mac and cheese - all good.  The service was also very good!
Always great. Just wish the girl who worked there Talia still worked there. She was great. This is a classic and a must eat at for everyone visiting the cave creek area
Don't let the name fool you, this place is really good. Best burger I've had in a long time. Only downside is the flies because it mostly outdoor seating.
Man... this was a great burger. I had the BBQ burger and it was awesome. First time here and will be coming back.

Having eaten here awhile back, we thought we would try it on New Years Day. I am sorry to report it was very disappointing.  We think this place is an icon and wish we could give a better review.   I ordered the bacon and blue salad with grilled chicken and dressing on the side.  The salad was served on a bed of romaine lettuce with blue cheese sprinkles four wedges of an unripe tomato that tasted like chlorine and not a speck of bacon!  The grilled chicken breast was way overcooked.  Besides no flavor or moisture, it was very difficult to chew.  After being advised there was no bacon on the salad, the waitress brought some bacon to the table to put on the salad.  Unfortunately, the salad was so bland and unpalatable, I was unable to eat more than a few bites.   Hubs ordered a burger and tator tots.  It was okay.  The burger was on the small side but it's hard to screw up a burger!  The tots were marginal.  We also ordered fries and they were okay.   No one ever checked back with us regarding the meal.  We won't be returning here again. There are too many other good options in CC that we will spend our $ at in the future.  Sorry.  We were really hoping for a better experience and a place to return to.

Big Earl's is by far the best burger restaurant to go to in Arizona. I absolutely love the Big Earl Burger and all of the adult milkshakes! The restaurant  was so inviting and SO clean!  Upon walking into the restaurant I was greeted by the cutest and friendliest girls, Lilly and Avalon. They were so sweet and happily continued to check in on my boyfriend and I as we ate. Another plus is that the patio is pup friendly so my dog was able to come enjoy the cave creek ambiance with us! Will DEFINITELY be back for more great food and great service.

I'd heard some good things, and my brother had been here a few times. I was entirely disappointed.  I went with my husband and daughter because I remembered it while we were looking for somewhere for a burger or sandwich.  Looks nice enough from the outside but inside is tiny and the floor was soaked by the soda machine.  Ok. Overlooking that.  It was our first time there, so I didn't know what to expect. I know I didn't expect zero quality customer service. I ordered a sandwich for myself and a burger for my husband while he got the stroller out of the car because there are no high chairs or booster seats (again, ok, overlooking). I wanted to ask if the "kidz" grilled cheese was smaller than a normal sandwich but chickened out under the "omg hurry up, woman" look I was getting from the girl behind the counter. She gave me the total, I said ok, and my husband stepped forward to pay.  She walked away from us.  She took some guy's drink order and discussed what went into it while we filled our soda cups. Like I said, it was our first time here...because she just walked away and left us there we weren't sure if we were actually supposed to pay then or after. Eventually we asked and got her attention long enough to pay.  Went outside to the patio to wait. My husband went through two chairs before finding one that wasn't broken or ripped.  When our food came out, she plopped it on the table and walked away. I swear she didn't even look at us. I know she didn't say anything to us. My husband's burger he said was pretty good. My chicken sandwich was pretty standard. Want friendly service or anyone who cares? Not your place. Maybe if you hang out at the bar. The one staff member we interacted with seemed perfectly amiable while pouring a drink.  I won't be going back.
Visiting for the week from San Diego and we couldn't get enough of this place. Awesome burgers and beer selection. We loved everything we tried!
Delicious burger and shake! I highly recommend it! It was a bit chilly sitting outside but they had a couple heaters to keep us warm.

I like this place. If you are looking for a good quick hamburger, hot dog or fries; this is the place. This reminds me of the drive-ins we use to frequent as youngsters. The service was fast and friendly. This is a dog friendly place. Nice to have one with so few around.

Fun place and sweet staff.  I wasn't liquored up with fireball and was here for a child's birthday party----so I stayed off the stripper poles.  Food was tasty but portions were small, hence the four out of five stars. Beautiful location.

We love Big Earls!  Great food in a great casual setting.  One of my favorite places to have breakfast in Cave Creek!   Big Earls also has some fun events to attend throughout the year- I've been here during the Wicked Pub Crawl, for their annual White Trash Bash and its a great seat for different parades the town of Cave Creek puts on!  If your in the area...you should definitely check this place out.
I ordered the blackened chicken sandwich, no mayo, and I got mayo sandwich with a side of chicken. Portions are small.   The venue is cool, but the food is not good.
Great beer selection. Great greasy foods. Milkshake was amazing. Outdoor seating. Volleyball court is nice.
Fun atmosphere! Pretty average burger. The milkshakes, beer, and tatertots were really great though! The staff was also super friendly! They have events which I'll definitely have to check out soon!

If you would like an order of FLIES...that is not a typo...with your burger, this place has got you covered.  There were way too many flies and inside there were other crawling bugs that fall from the ceiling.  It was truly a mistake to go here and we should have taken our food to go. But the food isn't even anything spectacular. You can get this type of food anywhere else in Phoenix.
Good food had the egg sandwich

I tend to agree with Shannon M. I thought the idea was great and definitely a cool place to stop but the food was nothing to boast about. Pretty average. They did have a good beer list and I was able to grab a Nitro Milk Stout and my guy an IPA. We brought a couple friends for a ride during bike week on a Saturday so I don't know if that's why it was so crowded but the line to order was really long. We all got burgers and fries. Pretty generous portions and there luckily were a lot of tables so we had no problem finding a place to sit. The atmosphere was great as we got to "bike watch" (when you like bikes more than people) and even caught the notorious Cave Creek sports car display. No one minds watching a 911, R8 and Ferrari pull in.  (wipes drool off lip) So overall this is a great place to take in some lunch on the weekend. I'd go back again if we rode up that way and see what else is on the menu that I might like.

I've been there a few times and its not bad if you are seeking a hamburger in a cute setting and you want to sit outside ad you have a dog with you. The burgers are nothing to brag about decent size and sweet potato fries were a bit overcooked and just your typical frozen fries. Service is pleasant but very slow for the food to come out.
Yummy breakfast burritos. Nice staff. Sweet owner whom always strives to exceed your expectations. Great place for Cave Creek.

BEST BURGERS IN PHOENIX AREA! Always great to people watch in Cave Creek, and Big Earls gives you a front row seat on it's (dog friendly) patio. The best burgers come from the best ingredients. And Big Earls delivers. I have been bringing my kids here since they were little for their cheeseburgers and fantastic biscuits and gravy. Their patty melt is also out of this world because they actually know how to caramelize onions. Not just grilled onions...caramelized. And the rye bread! Oh so good!

Breakfast was alright here, with pancakes being the highlight.  Biscuits were firm and dry.  Staff was somewhat polite, but after ordering I didn't see from them again (is this full service place or not?).  Little pricey for what you get.
The burger was unimaginative. The bun weird ~ can we try Brioche?  The  fries were yummy.  The boozy milkshake was beyond amazing!!!

While visiting friends in "the crick" last month, after late night  and too many cold favorites we couldn't pass up a place with a name like Big Earl's Greasy Eats. I had the machaca and egg burrito with green chilies, on word "AWESOME'!  This place is not lacking in atmosphere originally was a gas station (i think), retro diner feel, outdoor bathroom, cool tattooed short order grill "chick", I felt like I was on the set of a Quentin Tarantino shoot! I will definitely make a stop at Big Earl's on next trip to the Crick! Thanks Earl!
